boardgame.name: Evo
ЭВО. Век динозавров
進化戰爭
boardgame.description: 217,453,883 years, seven months and 26 days before our time, the first dinosaurs left their home in the sea and climbed onto the land. The ever-changing climate was their first adversary, forcing them to remain constantly on the move. But weather was not their only problem. In order to survive and flourish, they had to evolve, and to do it quickly!_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;In Evo, you control the survival and evolution of a species of dinosaurs called Dinos. You guide their migrations to temperate climates, you acquire the perfect genes to develop your Dinos and mutate them, and you push out other creatures that have yet to learn the meaning of the term _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;dominant species_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;. At the end of the game, you and your Dinos will not be the winners unless you've evolved more quickly and successfully than everyone else._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Each turn is divided into six phases, in which Dinos move, fight, reproduce and evolve to ensure that their species has the characteristics to survive the various perils of prehistoric life. Players earn and spend mutation points to adapt their species for survival _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; but don't spend all of them as the remainder are counted to determine the winner._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;With every round of play a meteor moves one step closer to earth. When the meteor strikes (determined partly by dice), the game ends!_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2002 Games Magazine Game of the Year Winner
2002 International Gamers Awards - General Strategy; Multi-player Nominee
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 9: Panamax, They Live, and Solforge

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: We played this game once, so the pieces have been punched out, but otherwise the game is in mint condition. It_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s a fun game, but I don_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t expect my group will be playing it much, so I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;m freeing up some shelf space.

If you do not wish to use PayPal, you may pay me directly (via website or phone) using any major credit card. Shipping is $7.00 for UPS Ground to US locations (no PO Boxes, AK or HI). If you need a different type of shipping or any questions answered, please email before purchasing. CA orders pay 7.25% sales tax. For more info visit www.gamesinabox.com.

Game only - this game does not have a box. I was in a car accident and I was holding the box on my lap when it happened. When the air bag went off, the box exploded from the impact. The game is playable. It is missing one brown cylinder marker. Other than that, all pieces are accounted for and in great condition. This is a great way to play the game for a fraction of the cost or if you need replacement pieces for your set. Shipping will be FedEx from Florida.

The game is opened but unplayed. The4 box is in excellent condition, and I can see no damage on the box or pieces/board. I’ll charge $17 for shipping within the continental U.S., and shipping cost plus $3 outside the U.S.. I’m selling off most of my games. If you want a list of all I have for sale, just click on my name (Seller: Too Many Games). If you want to buy more than one item, I’ll charge the actual shipping cost plus $2 (to cover costs of the packaging etc.).

This is the English language edition. It comes with bonus dinosaur and meteor miniatures. For some reason I can_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t get the site to include my image with the item listing, so a (blurry) picture of the miniatures is in my gallery, here: http://boardgamegeek.com/image/828932/lindsey?size=original The box top has an outward bow. Box bottom shows light dirt on its corners. The plastic insert is gone (to fit the miniatures). The rulebook is in good condition -- It_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s clean, but has a bend near the bottom of the booklet. The cards and tiles are in good condition, with light dirt and wear. The player boards are in good condition, with light dirt. The bag, weather board, bidding board, and map are all in very good condition. The game comes with five sets of ten properly sized plastic painted dinosaurs. (You_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ll get the original wooden dinosaur markers, too.) Similarly, the game comes with a fancy translucent painted meteor (really a D_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;D miniatures figure called _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Living Flaming Sphere_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;) as well as the original black meteor cylinder. Shipping charge will be an estimate of the actual cost of shipping the game to you. That means I can usually reduce shipping charges if you buy more than one of my games -- Send me a message and I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ll calculate the discount.

Asmodee (ASM EVO02) 217,453,883 years, seven months and 26 days before our time, the first dinosaurs left their home in the sea and climbed onto the land. The ever-changing climate was their first adversary, forcing them to remain constantly on the move. But weather was not their only problem. In order to survive and flourish, they had to evolve, and to do it quickly! In Evo, you control the survival and evolution of a species of dinosaurs called Dinos. You guide their migrations to temperate climates, you acquire the perfect genes to develop your Dinos and mutate them, and you push out other creatures that have yet to learn the meaning of the term _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;dominant species_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;. At the end of the game, you and your Dinos will not be the winners unless you_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ve evolved more quickly and successfully than everyone else. Each turn is divided into six phases, in which Dinos move, fight, reproduce and evolve to ensure that their species has the characteristics to survive the various perils of prehistoric life. Players earn and spend mutation points to adapt their species for survival – but don_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t spend all of them as the remainder are counted to determine the winner. With every round of play a meteor moves one step closer to earth. When the meteor strikes (determined partly by dice), the game ends!

Unpunched and in great shape EXCEPT that it is missing one of the _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;horn_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; gene tiles. This will affect game play-- either you will need to make a replacement that feels the same as the other gene tiles when being pulled from the bag, or you will need to play with a different mix/amount of gene tiles than was intended. Or I suppose you could make a cruder replacement and then use a different method to select gene tiles rather than drawing them out of the bag. Other than the missing tile, all other game components are unpunched and in great shape, and the box is also in great condition with no split corners.
